name: series
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: series
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a number of similar or related events or things, one following another

example.eg: There has been a series of sexual attacks on women in the area.
example.egtrans: 这个地区发生了一连串针对女性的性侵犯案件。

example.eg: She gave a series of lectures at Warwick University last year on contemporary British writers.
example.egtrans: 她去年在华威大学作了一系列有关当代英国作家的讲座。

trans_examp.trans_en: a number of games played one after another by two teams against each other

example.eg: The Yankees have a four-game series against the Orioles at home.
example.egtrans: 扬基队主场有一连四场对金莺队的比赛。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: Parts of an electrical system that are in series are arranged in a single line so that the current flows through each part, one after another.

dsense.name: series
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of television or radio broadcasts on the same subject or using the same characters but in different situations

example.eg: The star is to host a television series on extreme sports.
example.egtrans: 这位明星将主持一档关于极限运动的电视系列节目。

example.eg: I missed the second episode of the series so I don't know what's going on now.
example.egtrans: 我错过了系列剧的第二集，所以不知道现在的剧情进展如何。

dsense.name: series
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of books published by the same company that deal with the same subject

example.eg: They do a series on architecture throughout the ages.
example.egtrans: 他们出版一套介绍各个时代建筑的系列图书。
